parts.text: {"word":"dispersarse","priority":"N/A","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"pronominal","definition":"(人や物が)散らばる、分散する、解散する","english_definition":"(of people or things) to scatter, disperse, spread out, break up, disband.","examples":[{"sentence":"La multitud se dispersó después del discurso.","translation":"演説の後、群衆は散らばった。"},{"sentence":"Las semillas se dispersaron por el viento.","translation":"種は風によって散らばった。"},{"sentence":"Después de la fiesta, todos se dispersaron.","translation":"パーティーの後、皆は解散した。"}],"collocations":["dispersarse la multitud (群衆が散らばる)","dispersarse las nubes (雲が散らばる)","dispersarse las semillas (種が散らばる)"],"synonyms":["esparcirse","diseminarse","desbandarse","desunirse","desaparecer"],"antonyms":["reunirse","concentrarse","agruparse","juntarse"],"conjugation":{"present":["me disperso","te dispersas","se dispersa","nos dispersamos","os dispersáis","se dispersan"],"preterite":["me dispersé","te dispersaste","se dispersó","nos dispersamos","os dispersasteis","se dispersaron"],"imperfect":["me dispersaba","te dispersabas","se dispersaba","nos dispersábamos","os dispersabais","se dispersaban"],"future":["me dispersaré","te dispersarás","se dispersará","nos dispersaremos","os dispersaréis","se dispersarán"],"conditional":["me dispersaría","te dispersarías","se dispersaría","nos dispersaríamos","os dispersaríais","se dispersarían"],"subjunctive_present":["me disperse","te disperses","se disperse","nos dispersemos","os disperséis","se dispersen"],"subjunctive_imperfect":["me dispersara/se","te dispersaras/ses","se dispersara/se","nos dispersáramos/semos","os dispersarais/seis","se dispersaran/sen"],"imperative":["(tú) dispérsate","(vosotros) dispersaos"]}],"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Dispersarse' is a pronominal verb, meaning it requires a reflexive pronoun (me, te, se, nos, os, se). It describes the action of something scattering or spreading out. It can refer to physical objects, groups of people, or even abstract things like clouds or ideas. The antonyms refer to the opposite action of gathering or concentrating.","priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["dispersión (noun: dispersion, scattering)","disperso (adjective: dispersed, scattered)"],"related_verbs":["dispersar (transitive verb: to disperse, scatter)"]},"level_frequency":{"level":"B2","frequency":"Relatively common in written and spoken Spanish."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"La policía ordenó a los manifestantes que se dispersaran.","translation":"The police ordered the protesters to disperse.","type":"example"},{"sentence":"El humo se dispersó rápidamente después de la explosión.","translation":"The smoke dispersed quickly after the explosion.","type":"example"},{"sentence":"Es importante que las ideas se dispersen para fomentar la creatividad.","translation":"It's important that ideas are dispersed to foster creativity.","type":"example"}]}],"etymology":{"value":"From Latin 'dispergere', meaning 'to scatter'.","priority":"N/A"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/dis.perˈsaɾ.se/","notes":"Pronunciation can vary slightly depending on the region."}}
